content:
• Tuesday, August 21, 2012
  • UCTT

    Ultra Clean Technologies (NASDAQ:UCTT) -13.4% AH after warning it expects Q3 revenue of...

    Ultra Clean Technologies (NASDAQ:UCTT) -13.4% AH after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $96M-$101M, below a $109.9M consensus. Expected EPS of $0.10-$0.14 is in-line with a $0.12 consensus. The chip equipment maker blames weak industry demand. Also, Ultra Clean says a major customer to in-source gas panel manufacturing could have a 7%-9% revenue impact by the end of 2013. Applied Materials warned last month, and reported a major drop in chip equipment bookings last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM

  • Alexza Pharmaceuticals gets the green light from the EU on its certificate of GMP manufacturer...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals gets the green light from the EU on its certificate of GMP manufacturer compliance. In May, the company hosted an EU GMP inspection of it's Mountain View, California facility, and today's approval decision is a big step towards eventually getting Adasuve cleared for marketing in Europe. The initial certificate is valid through May 15, 2015. Shares +7.9% AH

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU): Q2 EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $72.8M (+107% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU): Q2 EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $72.8M (+107% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 8 Comments

  • In its mid-quarter update, Ultra Clean Technologies says its about to potentially lose a major...

    In its mid-quarter update, Ultra Clean Technologies says its about to potentially lose a major customer. The company notes that one of its larger semiconductor equipment customers has decided to insource a portion of their gas panel business in the future. While the decision won't have a material impact on revenue in the second half, it could have a negative quarterly impact of 7% to 9% on total revenue by the end of 2013. Shares -12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • CVI

    Carl Icahn is reportedly withdrawing his offer to take CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI) private due to...

    Carl Icahn is reportedly withdrawing his offer to take CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI) private due to deteriorating market conditions. In a letter, he states: "A number of market conditions have changed, including a significant widening of crack spreads. We no longer think that the proposed transaction is feasible at this time and we hereby withdraw it." Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ), which reports tomorrow, is down 2% AH in response to Dell's (DELL-OLD) revenue...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ), which reports tomorrow, is down 2% AH in response to Dell's (DELL-OLD) revenue miss and bleak guidance. Dell's weak PC sales figures have to be especially worrisome, especially since they follow a revenue miss from Acer. Lenovo posted better results recently, but it has been gaining share for a while. Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) and AMD are off slightly.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • LZB

    More on La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ1 meets on its EPS and beats on revenue as sales rose over 7.6%...

    More on La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ1 meets on its EPS and beats on revenue as sales rose over 7.6% Y/Y. Same-store written sales for the La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries +9.2%, upholstery segment sales +9.5%, Delivered sales +17%. Shares +7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • INTU

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) declares $0.17/share quarterly dividend, 13% increase from prior dividend...

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) declares $0.17/share quarterly dividend, 13% increase from prior dividend of $0.15. Forward yield 1.18%. For shareholders of record Oct 10. Payable Oct 18. Ex-div date Oct 08. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • WSM

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Brand sales strong across the board, with Pottery Barn and...

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Brand sales strong across the board, with Pottery Barn and West Elm showing double digit growth. E-commerce revenue up 13.9% Y/Y to $361M. Announces plans to open first stores outside of North America by setting up shop in Australia. Guides full-year revenue growth to 7%-8% and EPS to $2.44-$2.51. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ1 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $301.5M (+7.6% Y/Y) beats by $11M....

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ1 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $301.5M (+7.6% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $874.3M (+7.3% Y/Y) beats...

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $874.3M (+7.3% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +7.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • AZPN

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): FQ2 EPS of -$0.04 in-line. Revenue of $64M (+21.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): FQ2 EPS of -$0.04 in-line. Revenue of $64M (+21.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • INTU

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $651M (+14% Y/Y) in-line....

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU): FQ4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $651M (+14% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • TGH

    Textainer Group Holdings (TGH -3.4%) trades lower on a downgrade to Neutral from Buy at Nomura...

    Textainer Group Holdings (TGH -3.4%) trades lower on a downgrade to Neutral from Buy at Nomura on weak container demand, plus slowing capex and softer oversees container growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • RAVN

    Raven Industries (RAVN -9%) takes a hit after the industrial products manufacturer reported Q2...

    Raven Industries (RAVN -9%) takes a hit after the industrial products manufacturer reported Q2 earnings that missed bottom line estimates. The company was hit by volatility in its Aerostar division, where operating income declined by over 30%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • JJGTF

    "For the first time in this rally, there is a feel of commercial panic," says a broker after a...

    "For the first time in this rally, there is a feel of commercial panic," says a broker after a 2nd day of the Pro Farmer crop tour adds to worries over the security of physical grain supplies (day 1 report here). "You cannot load soybean futures in a ship and send to China (or) feed to chickens and hogs ... panic is in the physical ownership." Price records are falling everywhere. JJG +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 8 Comments
  • SKX

    Skechers (SKX +9.9%) goes on a roller coaster ride after a SEC filing (13D) reveals a...

    Skechers (SKX +9.9%) goes on a roller coaster ride after a SEC filing (13D) reveals a distribution of a large block of shares from investor Gil Schwartzberg that appears to be tied to estate planning. The price action may be a speculative read by investors that the shares - repping over 9% of the company - are now freed up for a buyout play.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AUXL

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -4%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to...

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -4%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to Underweight from Equal Weight this morning, saying that Street expectations for Testim and Xiaflex are too high.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • XSPA

    Volatile Vringo (VRNG +7.9%) is jumping today. The IP holder has received more favorable...

    Volatile Vringo (VRNG +7.9%) is jumping today. The IP holder has received more favorable write-ups (previous) from SA authors this week: Scott Matusow argued settlements made by Microsoft and Research In Motion with other patent holders bode well for Vringo, while MarketScanners predicted rumors of a settlement with Google will gain steam ahead of a trial due to start on Oct. 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -2.1%) slips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares earlier this morning to...

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -2.1%) slips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares earlier this morning to Underweight from Equal Weight. The firm cites concerns over the impact of generic competition on its revenue growth, warning that up to 80% of its total revenue may be threatened by cheaper generic alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • ENG

    ENGlobal (ENG -27.7%) is getting hammered after badly missing on its Q2 earnings results late...

    ENGlobal (ENG -27.7%) is getting hammered after badly missing on its Q2 earnings results late yesterday. The miss puts the firm in violation of covenants under its new credit facility, generating some concerns about its near-term liquidity. KeyBanc cuts the shares to Hold on the back of the report, citing the liquidity concerns plus a lack of near-term visibility.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • FB

    As Facebook (FB -3.4%) sells off on news director/seed investor Peter Thiel has cashed out in a...

    As Facebook (FB -3.4%) sells off on news director/seed investor Peter Thiel has cashed out in a big way, VC Fred Wilson defends Thiel's actions by arguing investors are obligated to return capital to clients as quickly as possible. But as Dan Primack points out, most of Thiel's sales involved his personal stake in Facebook. VC Ann Winblad also defends Thiel, but thinks Facebook and other public companies are better off not having VCs such as Thiel serve as board members.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 7 Comments
  • GLD

    Gold's move to $1,642/oz. - the highest price since early May - catches the eye of the...

    Gold's move to $1,642/oz. - the highest price since early May - catches the eye of the technicians as what  was though to be a bearish triangle has been resolved ... to the upside. GLD +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 20 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -4.9%) is diving on worries Qihoo 360's (QIHU +8.1%) new search engine, questionable...

    Baidu (BIDU -4.9%) is diving on worries Qihoo 360's (QIHU +8.1%) new search engine, questionable links and all, is a potential threat. ThinkEquity recently noted some companies are already seeing more referral traffic from Qihoo's search engine, which is tied to its popular browser, than Sohu's (NASDAQ:SOHU) Sogou, the #2 Chinese search engine. S&P's Scott Kessler is defending Baidu in response.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -4.2%) is selling off for the second day in a row; shares are down 10% on the week...

    Yelp (YELP -4.2%) is selling off for the second day in a row; shares are down 10% on the week thus far. An Aug. 29 lockup expiration could be weighing on investors, particularly given how Facebook and Angie's List traded following last week's expirations. Compared with other recent consumer Web IPOs, Yelp has held up fairly well.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • SIRI

    Don't look now, but shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +1.4%) just hit a 4-year high of $2.64 after...

    Don't look now, but shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +1.4%) just hit a 4-year high of $2.64 after naysayers carped earlier this summer that they wouldn't ever see $2 again. The company confirmed today that it will use new debt issuance to retire higher-paying notes, a visibility move that SA author Stephen Faulkner applauds as balance sheet-friendly.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    Jefferies says Onyx Pharmaceutical (ONXX +6.3%) is positioned for a strong Kyprolls launch ....

    Jefferies says Onyx Pharmaceutical (ONXX +6.3%) is positioned for a strong Kyprolls launch . After conducting a survey, the firm says the drug's impact is deeply undervalued by the Street and may significantly surpass estimates, which it turn will benefit its share price. It reiterates a Buy rating and maintains a $101 target on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal producers (KOL +1.4%) show strength on news the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit...

    Coal producers (KOL +1.4%) show strength on news the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit has put on hold an EPA rule over limits on sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxide emissions. The decision sends the rule back to the agency for revision. ANR +8%, JRCC +5.4%, BTU +4.8%, WLB +4.7%, CNX +2.2%, ACI +2%, CLD +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 36 Comments
  • TSL

    Proving once again the Street's actual expectations for solar companies are often far worse than...

    Proving once again the Street's actual expectations for solar companies are often far worse than analyst forecasts, Trina Solar (TSL +5.2%) is now rallying after badly missing Q2 estimates, cutting its shipment guidance, and reporting a major increase in inventory. A Q2 gross margin of 8.4%, down from 17% in the year-ago period but up from Q1's 5.8% could be encouraging bulls. Solar peers are also rallying (TAN +2.6%). Some big winners: FSLR +9.1%. YGE +5.1%. SOL +6.9%. JKS +4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM +7%) jumps after posting better-than-expected FQ4 results as the...

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM +7%) jumps after posting better-than-expected FQ4 results as the producer of silicon metal and other silicon-based alloys increased production efficiency and lowered costs. "The diverse end markets that we serve including steel, autos, consumer goods and solar continue to grow despite headwinds in Europe," CEO Jeff Bradley says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • CAS

    An investor group including financier Tom Gores and Chicago metals firm Ryerson reveals they...

    An investor group including financier Tom Gores and Chicago metals firm Ryerson reveals they have taken a ~6.1% stake in specialty metals and plastics distributor A. M. Castle (CAS +16.7%), seeking to "engage in discussions" on the business including "a possible acquisition by one or more of the reporting persons."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • LPHI

    Life Partners Holdings (LPHI +17.4%) bounces back somewhat today on the back of yesterday's...

    Life Partners Holdings (LPHI +17.4%) bounces back somewhat today on the back of yesterday's announcement that a Texas district judge on Friday refused to grant state officials the right to block Life Partners' business or appoint a receiver. The order allows LPHI to continue conducting its business pending a temporary injunction hearing set for August 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) rallies on a bullish note from ITG Research. The firm thinks Q3 revenue will...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) rallies on a bullish note from ITG Research. The firm thinks Q3 revenue will come in at $253.8M, soundly above a $242.9M consensus that itself rose following LinkedIn's strong Q2 report. ITG believes higher order volumes and revenue/customer will produce a beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +1.7%) has more than recouped the early losses it saw thanks to Barclays'...

    Groupon (GRPN +1.7%) has more than recouped the early losses it saw thanks to Barclays' downgrade, as shorts cover and perhaps some bargain hunters swoop in. Barclays is worried Groupon's e-commerce sales, which are keeping its revenue and billings from plunging, have 1/3 the gross margin of daily deals sales. It also thinks marketing spending, which has been dialed back considerably in recent quarters, may go back up in response to slowing customer growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    Airline stocks trade higher again, even with crude oil prices showing resiliency lately....

    Airline stocks trade higher again, even with crude oil prices showing resiliency lately. Analysts are divided if a fare hike by legacy carriers or a more broad warming up to the sector from investors on consolidation and labor progress is behind the resurgence. Leading the pack: LCC +6.4%, DAL +3.7%, UAL +1.3%, ALK +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +8.7%) says its multicrystalline PV modules successfully passed the...

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +8.7%) says its multicrystalline PV modules successfully passed the Potential Induced Degradation test conducted by Intertek Group. The tests were designed to assess power output under severe conditions of high voltage, high temperature and high humidity. According to the results, YGE modules ranked at the top of the class.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • EVEP-OLD

    EV Energy (EVEP-OLD +4.9%) jumps on production results for its Utica Shale wells. The...

    EV Energy (EVEP-OLD +4.9%) jumps on production results for its Utica Shale wells. The Cairns 5H well flow tested at a 24-hour rate of 1,690 boe/day, while the Frank 2H well produced into sales at an unassisted 24-hour rate of 870 boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • NDSN

    Shares of Nordson (NDSN +12.5%) jump after its FQ3 results easily beat across the board late...

    Shares of Nordson (NDSN +12.5%) jump after its FQ3 results easily beat across the board late yesterday. Net earnings rose 18% Y/Y, on strength in its organic volume and rising backlog. The company also ups its current quarter forecast, now expecting FQ4 sales to rise 23% to 27% over year-ago levels. Earnings are seen in a range of $0.96 to $1.04 a share. Street estimates are for 19.2% year-over-year sales growth and a $0.95 a share profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF +4.3%) jumps following an upgrade from Dick Bove, who now labels the stock...

    Jefferies (JEF +4.3%) jumps following an upgrade from Dick Bove, who now labels the stock Undervalued instead of Fairly Valued. Clearly the firm stands to benefit from Knight Capital's difficulties, but shares - up more than 20% since Knight's incident - may already reflect that.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -0.9%) bounce around with chatter on a LBO disrupting the Ron Johnson...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -0.9%) bounce around with chatter on a LBO disrupting the Ron Johnson bash-a-thon for the moment. Option activity is elevated, as speculators get their bets in before the wheel stops spinning.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 7 Comments
  • CHK

    Is Chesapeake (CHK +3.5%) enjoying something of a renaissance? Shares have quietly advanced 34%...

    Is Chesapeake (CHK +3.5%) enjoying something of a renaissance? Shares have quietly advanced 34% in the past three months, natural gas prices have climbed 45% from the April low, and CHK may be getting its house in order. Canaccord reiterates its Buy rating, noting that CHK's net debt should end $1B less than the year-end 2012 target of $9.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • HGG

    hhgregg (HGG -3.4%) and RadioShack (RSH -2.1%) fall lower with the news out of Best Buy casting...

    hhgregg (HGG -3.4%) and RadioShack (RSH -2.1%) fall lower with the news out of Best Buy casting a dark shadow over big box retailers. Of the two names, RadioShack has had an easier time hitting revenue targets with its reliance on smartphones contributing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +2.7%) outperforms after ThinkEquity resumes coverage with a Buy. Crushed...

    InvenSense (INVN +2.7%) outperforms after ThinkEquity resumes coverage with a Buy. Crushed earlier this year, shares of the MEMS motion sensor developer have been on a roll in recent weeks, aided by a healthy Q2 report, positive analyst coverage, and most likely (considering 14.9% of the float was shorted as of July 31) short-covering.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +0.7%) show increased volatility with rumors cropping up again...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +0.7%) show increased volatility with rumors cropping up again that the company is in play. For the most part, traders are skittish after seeing late buyers get burned when chatter of a Coca-Cola buyout of Monster fizzled last spring.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • BBY

    With all the cutting at Best Buy (BBY -6.2%), a decent amount of free cash flow looks to have...

    With all the cutting at Best Buy (BBY -6.2%), a decent amount of free cash flow looks to have helped the company's dividend survive the chopping block for the time being. But even with an offer on the table at $24-$26 and a nice little 4% yield as a kicker, investors are shying away and betting against a turnaround. Wedbush Securities analyst Michael Pachter cuts to the chase: "This is a herculean task even for an accomplished retail executive...Mr. Joly's complete lack of retail experience will be an impediment to his success."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +7%) has been rallying strongly ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report; shares are...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +7%) has been rallying strongly ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report; shares are up 16.7% over the last two days. Today's gains come in spite of a column from TechInAsia accusing Qihoo's new search engine, so.360.cn, of "engaging in dirty tricks" to boost referral traffic to other Qihoo properties. Qihoo's traffic data has been criticized in the past by Citron Research, hacker collective Anonymous, and others.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • ERF

    Enerplus (ERF +4.6%) agrees to sell its equity stake in Laricina Energy, a private Canadian...

    Enerplus (ERF +4.6%) agrees to sell its equity stake in Laricina Energy, a private Canadian company focused on oil-sands development, for C$141M. ERF says it will use the proceeds to repay bank debt. Raymond James upgrades the stock to Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • BBY

    Quick hits from Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) CC: Backs new CEO Hubert Joly as the turnaround specialist...

    Quick hits from Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) CC: Backs new CEO Hubert Joly as the turnaround specialist the company needs. Remains optimistic on margins as a greater mix of smartphones is introduced. Execs paint an ugly picture for international sales growth, particularly China. Sees different strategic plan and new products helping to boost earnings in H2. Shares -9.7% premarket. (webcast) (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -4.3% to $4.45 after Barclays gives up, downgrading shares to...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -4.3% to $4.45 after Barclays gives up, downgrading shares to Underperform. Evercore did the same on Friday. Separately, Groupon bear Rocky Agrawal observes an increase in reports of Groupon threatening to sue small businesses who want to end their daily deals offers after not being paid on time. A former Groupon sales rep blames the finance department, and adds, "This ship is sinking faster than I thought it would." (more on GRPN)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 5 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures are green and EU shares are mostly green - it must mean that...

    Market preview: Stock futures are green and EU shares are mostly green - it must mean that markets continue to dream about further stimulus. A well-received Spanish bond auction is also helping. The S&P benchmark is +0.2%. However, Best Buy continues to be a Bad Buy, with shares tumbling 9.7% following its earnings, although Urban Outfitters is outperforming (+16.85%) after its results.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • BKS

    Though Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) piggybacked off the success of adult series Fifty Shades of...

    Though Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) piggybacked off the success of adult series Fifty Shades of Grey to beat expectations for books sales in its FQ1, it's the college segment that warrants attention according to analysts. Comparable college store sales fell 2.0% Y/Y during the period, which doesn't set up well for the current quarter in which the segment really needs to percolate. Shares of BKS +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • DMDA

    Premarket gainers: DEXO +35%. URBN +16%. NDSN +10%. PRAN +7%. PSTI +6%. Losers: OTCPK:IMUC -15%....

    Premarket gainers: DEXO +35%. URBN +16%. NDSN +10%. PRAN +7%. PSTI +6%.
    Losers: OTCPK:IMUC -15%. BBY -10%. VHC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) +6% premarket on news the Israeli drug developer renews a...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) +6% premarket on news the Israeli drug developer renews a five-year partnership with a German research institution, a collaboration CEO Zami Aberman says has been highly supportive of its product pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    More on Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS): Revenue at retail segment grew 2% to $1.1B, with the...

    More on Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS): Revenue at retail segment grew 2% to $1.1B, with the liquidation of Borders bookstores and strong sales of the Fifty Shades of Grey series helping to boost book sales. Nook digital content sales rose 46% Y/Y. Expects Newco transaction with Microsoft to close in the Fall. Shares +5.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBY

    More on Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Comparable-store sales down 1.6% Y/Y, with international falling...

    More on Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Comparable-store sales down 1.6% Y/Y, with international falling off 8.2%. Domestic market share maintained. Suspends it share buyback. Pulls specific earnings guidance for FY13, saying only that it has reduced its expectations. Conference call ongoing (webcast). Shares -8.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSL

    More on Trina Solar's (NYSE:TSL) Q2: "Industry overcapacity and demand constraints in newer and...

    More on Trina Solar's (NYSE:TSL) Q2: "Industry overcapacity and demand constraints in newer and traditional PV markets contributed to deflationary pricing pressures." Solar module shipments were 419 MW, gross margin was 8.4%, both in-line. Cuts estimates on module shipments for Q3 to 450-480 MW and the full fiscal year to 1.75-1.8 GW from 2-2.1 GW. TSL -7.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q2 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $10.5B (-3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q2 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $10.5B (-3% Y/Y) misses by $150M. Shares -8.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • FOSL

    Shares of Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) slump 1.8% premarket after ISI Group downgrades the retail name...
